record.ty_nm: Fill in the blanks with the help of the given options

record.ch_nm: 5. What are you doing at the weekend?
10. A mango and some bananas, please

record.qu_text:
Which of these is a negative sentence?
a. I want to dance.
b. Can you shout?
c. Do not play here.
d. Where is he?

Which of these word describes a masculine gender?
a. Table
b. Girl
c. Cup
d. King

Which of these is a proper noun?
a. Men
b. April
c. Teacher
d. Dancer

If you are an athlete, what can you do?
a. You can dance.
b. You can sing.
c. You can run fast.
d. You can paint.

Which of these verbs is in the present continuous form?
a. Dance
b. Singing
c. Run
d. Act

What word can we use to make a request to someone?
a. please
b. sorry
c. thanks
d. hello

Which of these sentences shows that the sun is out?
a. It's sunny.
b. It's raining.
c. It's snowing.
d. It's foggy.

Which of the following sentences is in past form?
a. You were quite tired.
b. I am a shy girl.
c. She plays guitar.
d. My friend is in Nepal.

Which of these is not an irregular verb?
a. go
b. buy
c. break
d. wash

Which of the following sentences is correct?
a. I have some pencils in my pencil box.
b. I have any pencils in my pencil box.
c. I have a pencils in my pencil box.
d. I have an pencils in my pencil box.

Which of these cannot be used as a pronoun?
a. these
b. that
c. those
d. Swati

Which of these is an adjective?
a. food
b. friendly
c. man
d. colour

Which of these is an adverb?
a. beautiful
b. deaf
c. blue
d. politely

Select the preposition of place.
a. because
b. above
c. those
d. them

Select the adjective from the given words.
a. dark
b. lion
c. guns
d. bed

In the sentence, 'Suddenly, the gingerbread man jumped out of the oven and ran away from the house!', what is 'and'?
a. a preposition
b. a verb
c. an adjective
d. a conjunction

Match the following sentences with their type.
1. Positive sentencea. Do not close the door.
2. Negative sentenceb. Where is my sister?
3. Questionc. Wow! Beautiful picture.
4. Exclamatoryd. The song is nice.

Match the following nouns with their gender.
1. Teachera. Masculine
2. Chairb. Feminine
3. Heroinec. Common
4. Liond. Neuter

Match the following proper nouns with what they describe.
1. Januarya. Place
2. Mondayb. People
3. Mrs Raic. Month
4. Punjabd. Day

Match the sentences appropriately.
1. Suhani is a chef. a. I can't play outside.
2. It is raining.b. Can you give me a pencil?
3. I forgot to bring my pencil box.c. She can bake a cake.
4. This is a Chemist shop.d. You can't buy books here.

Match the incomplete sentences to make plans.
1. I am going to a. helping Ravi.
2. I am playing b. home.
3. I am staying atc. watch a movie.
4. We will be d. with Suman.

Match the following to complete the sentences.
1. Can you helpa. that new television show.
2. Can you showb. me carry the luggage?
3. I'd like to watchc. her for the question papers?
4. Can I askd. me the way to the school?

Match the following images with the adjectives that describe them.
1.
a. Let's build a snowman as it's snowing.
2.
b. It's windy! Your umbrella will blow away in the wind.
3.
c. Let's go to the beach as it's sunny.
4.
d. It's raining! Want to go for a walk in the rain?

Match the questions with the answers.
1. Where were you in the morning?a. She was wearing a coat.
2. What was she wearing?b. He was at his shop.
3. Were they interested?c. I was at school.
4. Where was the shopkeeper?d. They weren't interested.

Match the following images with their description.
1.
a. We bought fruits yesterday.
2.
b. We won the tournament yesterday.
3.
c. She walked to school yesterday.
4.
d. She played cricket yesterday.

Match the words in the columns to complete the sentences.
1. aa. Himalayas
2. anb. ball
3. thec. orange

Match the following images with the personal pronouns.
1.
a. it
2.
b. she
3.
c. he
4.
d. I

Match the columns to make correct sentences.
1. It has been aa. in the old camp.
2. She was wearing a pair of b. the cold water.
3. The girl fell inc. blue jeans.
4. They were sittingd. hot day.

Match the sentences halves.
1. Radha is slow. a. She does her job quietly.
2. Ram is careful.b. He plays the sitar well.
3. Rakesh is a nice sitar player.c. He drives carefully.
4. Sima is a quiet girl.d. She walks slowly.

Match the columns to make correct sentences.
1. The man called his sona. on their beds.
2. There was no vehicleb. in the water.
3. A fly fell c. on the road.
4. They are sleepingd. in his room.

Match the sentence halves based on the conjunctions that are used.
1. My child is intelligenta. but it was a holiday.
2. I helped herb. so she was crying.
3. The baby did not have milk,c. because she was in trouble.
4. I wanted to go to school, d. and healthy.

Match the columns to make correct sentences.
1. A horse saw a. threw him up into the air.
2. Then the gingerbread manb. on to the fox’s back.
3. So, the gingerbread man jumpedc. came to a river.
4. Suddenly, the foxd. him and shouted.
The predicate tells us something about that person or thing in a sentence.
A noun is a name for a person, a place, an animal or a thing.
Proper nouns always begin with a capital letter.
'Mohit can go for picnic yesterday.' depicts the correct usage of can.
Verbs are doing words.
We use can you + verb to give order to someone.
When we say 'it's foggy' it means that it is raining.
'We was very angry.' shows the correct usage of was.
Irregular verbs change their spelling completely in the past form.
We use a before a word that starts with u when it is pronounced ‘you’.
That is a personal pronoun.
Words that describe people or things are called adjectives.
Some adverbs tell us when something happens.
We use There is + a or an for more than one person or thing.
The words and, but, so, because are used to join two parts of a sentence.
It was a happy ending for the gingerbread man.
______ the book on the table. (Keep, Do not keep)
The children ______ in the house. (are there, are not there)
______ a plastic monkey. (I have, I do not have)
Hari is a painter. He ______ paint well. (can, can't)
Shikha is unwell. She ______ play today. (can, can't)
Donna lives in France. She ______ speak French.
Today is my birthday. ______ (can, can't) I go and party with my friends.
Janet is American. She ______ (can, can't) understand Hindi.
My hand is injured. I ______ (can, can't) write properly.
______ do me a favour? (I'd like you, Can you)
______ to have a pet dog. (Can I, I'd like)
______ to drink a glass of water. (Can I, I'd like)
______ to buy a new shirt. (I'd like, Can I)
______ pick me up in the morning? (I'd want, Can you)
______ to go on the school trip. (Can you, I'd like)
______ are you wearing today? (What, Who)
______ are you crying? (Who, Why)
______ will you come home? (What, When)
______ are you going? (What, Where)
______ don't you listen to your mother? (Where, Why)
______ are you talking to? (When, Who)
They ______ curious to know the answer.
He ______ upset with me.
I had a headache. I ______ feeling well.
I ______ my clothes yesterday. (wash, washed)
I ______ a pizza yesterday. (ate, eat)
I ______ to the mall yesterday. (go, went)
I ______ my flight yesterday. (miss, missed)
She ______ me for a pen yesterday. (asked, ask)
They ______ a movie yesterday. (watch, watched)
This is ______ interesting book. (a, an)
He lives near ______ Taj Mahal. (a, the)
She was wearing ______ new dress yesterday. (an, a)
______ play football. (I, He)
______ is my dog. (This, These)
______ live in a small house. (We, She)
Karan always eats sweets. I think ______ is fond of them. (she, he)
Karan is reading a book. He thinks ______ is interesting. (she, it)
Pooja is Karan's sister. ______ is elder to him. (It, She)
Ram walks ______. (slowly, politely)
The child was crying ______. (loudly, happily)
The man was driving ______. (carefully, soon)
We went to the market ______. (tomorrow, today)
The kids were fighting over ______. (there, outside)
We will clean our rooms ______. (soon, late)
Deepa was playing ______ the park. (in, over)
They jumped ______ the moving train. (from, through)
Raj was standing ______ Jaya and Mala. (on, between, in)
He is swimming ______ the river. (in, above)
They ______ waiting for you. (are, is)
Atul ______ waiting for his father. (are, is)
Seema ______ watching television. (are, is)
We ______ in the same class. (are, is)
They must ______ how to speak Spanish. (learn, learned)
I have ______ your car. (wash, washed)
The thief ______ of the window. (jump, jumped)
I ______ to learn driving. (want, wanted)
We are going ______ the circus. (to, by)
She ______ coming to my wedding. (are, is)
Anchal ______ me out of her house. (chase, chased)
The cat will ______ the mouse. (catch, catched)
What is a sentence?
record.qu_ans: A sentence is a group of words that makes sense.

record.qu_text: What is a noun?
record.qu_ans: A noun is a name for a person, a place, an animal or a thing.

record.qu_text: What are proper nouns?
record.qu_ans: Proper nouns are nouns that begin with a capital letter. We use proper nouns for the names of specific people and places.

record.qu_text: Why do we use 'can'?
record.qu_ans: We use can for talking about ability.

record.qu_text: What are verbs? Give an example.
record.qu_ans: Verbs are doing words. Playing is an example of verb.

record.qu_text: What is a request?
record.qu_ans: A request is to politely ask someone to do something for us.

record.qu_text: When we want to know about the weather, what question do we ask?
Change the following sentence into a question. 'They were not laughing.'
How do we ask questions in the past tense?
record.qu_ans: We ask questions in the past tense with Did.

record.qu_text: When do we use the determiner some?
record.qu_ans: We use some to talk about more than one person or thing.

record.qu_text: Why do we use a pronoun?
record.qu_ans: We use a pronoun to avoid repetition of a noun.

record.qu_text: What is an adjective?
record.qu_ans: An adjective is a word that is used to describe people or things.

record.qu_text: What are the words that tell us how something happens called?
Why do we use There are + some ?
record.qu_ans: We use There are + some for more than one person or thing.

record.qu_text: Why are conjunctions used?
record.qu_ans: Conjunctions are used to join the two parts of a sentence.

record.qu_text: What did the gingerbread man always sing?
record.qu_ans: ‘Run, run, as fast as you can! You can’t catch me, I’m the gingerbread man!’

record.qu_text: What part in a sentence tells us who or what the sentence is about?
'Boxes' is a singular or a plural noun?
Is 'Boy' a proper noun or common noun?
What can a swimmer do?
Meeting is a verb. Yes or no?
How can we make a request when we are telling someone what we want?
record.qu_ans: By using I'd like + to have in the beginning of the sentence.

record.qu_text: What do we say when we have to tell someone that the sky is clear and the sun is out?
Complete the question 'Where ______ you?'.
What do we add when a regular verb ends in e to make the past form of a verb?
Which determiner do we use for negatives and questions?
What are pronouns that are used to talk about specific people or things called?
Write the opposite of the underlined word in the following sentence, 'Our teacher is quite old.'
'Mrs Desai walks slowly.' What is the adverb in this sentence?
Next to is a preposition of place. Yes or no?
What do we use in place of nouns to avoid repeating the noun?
Who ate the gingerbread man?

Choose the option that is not a question.
a. Is he young?
b. Is it cold outside?
c. Will you dance?
d. Aha! I love gulabjamuns.

Choose the option that is not a noun.
a. Saba
b. Play
c. Hand
d. Dog

Choose the proper noun that is not written correctly.
a. Suman
b. Mumbai
c. delhi
d. May

Choose the option that depicts the incorrect usage of the modal verb 'can'.
a. Can I come?
b. You can go.
c. She can come yesterday.
d. Akshay can swim.

Choose the option that is not in the present continuous form.
a. Playing
b. Singing
c. Dance
d. Driving

Select the word that we use after 'Can you' to ask someone to do something for us.
a. verb
b. noun
c. adjective
d. pronoun

Select the word that does not start with wh-.
a. What
b. Why
c. Who
d. How

Choose the option that depicts the incorrect usage of the modal verb 'were'.
a. We were eight players.
b. You were wrong.
c. She were sad.
d. Akshay and Manish were best friends.

Select the odd verb out.
a. miss
b. ask
c. watch
d. break

Select the odd one out.
a. an honest man
b. an egg
c. an hat
d. an animal

Select the option which is not a personal pronoun.
a. I
b. we
c. it
d. this

Which of these is not a pair of opposites?
a. Soft-Hard
b. Long-Short
c. Dark-Black
d. Old-Young

Select the odd word out.
a. today
b. tomorrow
c. everywhere
d. soon

Select the option which is not a preposition of place.
a. under
b. over
c. because
d. between

Select the option which is not a preposition.
a. at
b. between
c. because
d. under

Which of these was not there in the story?
a. old man
b. old woman
c. gingerbread man
d. hare

do not | does not
She ______ like it. I ______ want to talk to you. He ______ play with me. The teacher ______ punish students. I ______ talk much.
record.qu_ans: does not~do not~does not~does not~do not

record.qu_text:
masculine | feminine | neuter
Pen is a ______ gender. Dog is a ______ gender. Nurse is a ______ gender.

bottle | apple | zoo
My sister loves to eat an ______. We will visit the ______. I will buy a ______.

Friday | Noida | Raj
She lives in ______. I am waiting for my friend ______. Tomorrow is ______.

Seema | February | Sunday
My birthday is in ______. Can you come on ______ ? ______ is my sister.

can't | can | Can you
Clouds are dark. It ______ rain. The weather is stormy. I ______ go out and play. ______ help me in my homework?

watching | stay | running
I will be ______ in the morning. We will be ______ a new show on television. I am going to ______ with my mother.

drawing | celebrating | living
I will be ______ her birthday. We will be ______ together. I am ______ her face.

was | were | wasn't
Yes, he ______ well. She was in pain. She ______ happy. Yes, they ______ excited.

narrow | red | furry
The ______ cat sleeps all the time. The car could not enter the ______ street. I love your ______ shirt.

long | friendly | expensive
He is very ______. The shoes are too ______. Your hair is so ______.
